---
category: Vue.js
topic: Built-in Components
difficulty: Hard
options:
  - id: 1
    option: <KeepAlive include="CounterA,CounterC">
  - id: 2
    option: <KeepAlive include="[CounterA,CounterC]">
  - id: 3
    option: <KeepAlive exclude="CounterA,CounterC">
  - id: 4
    option: <KeepAlive include="{CounterA,CounterC}">
correctOptionId: 1
referenceLink: https://vuejs.org/guide/built-ins/keep-alive.html#keepalive
---

::question{:type="questionType"}
In the following code, how can KeepAlive be configured to only cache instances of CounterA and CounterC components?

<br />

```js
<script setup>
const components = {
  CounterA,
  CounterB,
  CounterC
}

const selectedComponent = ref("CounterA")
</script>

<template>
  <KeepAlive>
    <component :is="components[selectedComponent]" />
  </KeepAlive>
</template>
```

<br />

::playgroundLink{href="https://play.vuejs.org/#"}

::

::

::explanation{:type="explanationType"}

**The correct answer is to pass the include prop; include="CounterA,CounterC"**

<br />

KeepAlive can be configured to only cache specific components using the "include" prop with a comma-separated string of component names.

<br />

```js
<KeepAlive include="CounterA,CounterC">
  <component :is="components[selectedComponent]" />
</KeepAlive>
```

<br /> 
An alternative way is  to use the "exclude" prop to exclude components from being cached.

```js
<KeepAlive exclude="CounterB">
  <component :is="components[selectedComponent]" />
</KeepAlive>
```

::

::vueTip{:type="tip" :reference="https://vuejs.org/guide/built-ins/keep-alive.html#keepalive" :position="17"}

#text

Configure KeepAlive with include or exclude props to control which components are cached, using comma-separated component names.

#code

```js
<KeepAlive include="CounterA,CounterC">
  <component :is="components[selectedComponent]" />
</KeepAlive>
```

#tag

Built-in Components

::
